programme.title: Bones
programme.desc: A powerful divorce lawyer with a lot of enemies is murdered; the three-month separation between Booth and Brennan starts to take its toll.

programme.title: Bones
programme.desc: After an explosion in a hotel garage, the Jeffersonian team tries to identify victims by investigating remains found at the scene; Sweets works with a temporary partner (Danielle Panabaker) while Booth works on the department's budget.

programme.title: Bones
programme.desc: While investigating the death of an animal expo employee, the team is drawn into the world of animal trafficking; Brennan thinks she would be a good presidential candidate; Sweets and Daisy make a change.

programme.title: Bones
programme.desc: The team investigates the death of a woman whose body was found in the trash; Booth invites Sweets to stay with him and Brennan until he finds a new place.

programme.title: Bones
programme.desc: While examining bodies deemed unidentifiable, interns uncover the identity of a man who died in the 9/11 terrorist attacks.

programme.title: Bones
programme.desc: A pod containing the remains of a crime-scene cleaner washes onto a beach; Angela and Hodgins learn a secret about Cam.

programme.title: Bones
programme.desc: When a street artist falls into his own adhesive, he also lands on human remains that stay glued to his body; Booth searches a comedy club for suspects.

programme.title: Bones
programme.desc: When a psychic tries to help the spirit of a boy whose death the team is investigating, members of the team start to question their own feelings on life and death.

programme.title: Bones
programme.desc: When the team investigates the death of a dancer who was about to audition for a dance competition show, Booth and Brennan go under cover as contestants.

programme.title: Bones
programme.desc: The team investigates the death of an archaeologist who had just made an important discovery.

programme.title: Bones
programme.desc: When Angela and Hodgins wake to find a corpse in their bedroom, they believe Pelant is behind it; against Booth's wishes, Angela and Hodgins start their own investigation.

programme.title: Bones
programme.desc: The team investigates when two bodies are found at the same burial plot; Brennan and Booth discuss after-death arrangements; Daisy returns for the first time since the breakup.

programme.title: Bones
programme.desc: When a female roller derby skater is killed and dismembered, Angie goes under cover to help solve the case; Cam tries to learn more about Booth's secretive hospital appointments.

programme.title: Bones
programme.desc: While in the hospital after being shot at the lab, Brennan struggles with visions of her mother that defy her usual logic; evidence may link Brennan's attacker to the Jeffersonian.

programme.title: Bones
programme.desc: As the team investigates the death of a seemingly innocent 15-year-old boy, they learn that he was involved in illegal activity.

programme.title: MacGyver
programme.desc: MacGyver and Jack "steal" a priceless painting to draw out an infamous stolen art dealer; Riley's estranged father asks to be part of her life; Matty sends Bozer to a spy training camp.

programme.title: MacGyver
programme.desc: Mac and the team follow mercenaries who are transporting stolen lethal nerve gas; Jack confronts Elwood about Riley; Bozer is pushed to his limit in spy school.

programme.title: MacGyver
programme.desc: Mac must help college students stranded on a research ship in the Arctic Ocean; Jack kidnaps Elwood to find out what he's up to; Bozer's feelings toward Leanna grow stronger.

programme.title: MacGyver
programme.desc: The LAPD interrupts the team's Christmas celebration to arrest Mac for terrorism when they find a body in a building destroyed by a bomb Mac built.

programme.title: MacGyver
programme.desc: When Mac's nemesis rigs Mac's house with explosives and traps him and Jack inside, Mac uses a karaoke mic and an audio transformer to let the team know that the bomb is a distraction for a bigger one.

programme.title: MacGyver

programme.title: MacGyver
programme.desc: The team heads to New Orleans to track down a con artist posing as the wife of one of Jack's old CIA aliases; enemies of his old alias resurface looking for revenge.

programme.title: MacGyver
programme.desc: One of Murdoc's assassins agrees to hand over Murdoc to MacGyver in exchange for $10 million; the team finds itself protecting Murdoc from a former mentor who wants him dead; Jack realizes he may still have feelings for Riley's mother.

programme.title: Hawaii Five-0
programme.desc: Tani and Junior go under cover at a gym to track down a deadly batch of steroids; Danny and McGarrett work as bodyguards for Danny's high maintenance ex-mother-in-law, a famous romance novelist with whom he has never gotten along.

programme.title: Hawaii Five-0
programme.desc: The team investigates the murder of a window washer and finds that the victim is actually a renowned street artist; Grover and Adam look into the murder of a gambler; Junior helps his father when they are reminded of his sister's death.

programme.title: Hawaii Five-0
programme.desc: When the team must locate a girl who purchased a gun from a junkie, it discovers that the firearm, over the course of decades, has affected all of the teammates' lives.

programme.title: Hawaii Five-0
programme.desc: A murdered man's body may hold the key to a 20-year-old case involving a kidnapped girl whose father never stopped looking for her.

programme.title: Hawaii Five-0
programme.desc: Adam investigates the murder of an undercover FBI agent who was about to wed the daughter of a Yakuza leader; Noelani is held hostage and forced, along with her mentor Dr. Chu, to operate at gunpoint on a criminal.

programme.title: Hawaii Five-0
programme.desc: McGarrett helps his sister spy on her shady neighbors; a ride-share driver and his passenger are murdered; the team teases the youngest members when Junior escorts Tani to a wedding.

programme.title: Hawaii Five-0
programme.desc: Fugitive hacker Aaron Wright resurfaces to ask for help when his co-workers at the NSA are murdered; Junior speaks at the parole hearing of the drunken driver who killed his sister.

programme.title: Hawaii Five-0
programme.desc: Five-0 continues to hunt down escaped criminal Aaron Wright before he can sell cyber-weapons to the highest bidder; the lives of McGarrett and the team members are put in danger when a visitor comes to headquarters to make amends.

programme.title: Hawaii Five-0
programme.desc: A new ally helps McGarrett and the team when mob bosses on the island are targeted by an assassin; the team says goodbye to one of its own.

programme.title: Hawaii Five-0
programme.desc: Tani and Junior must plot an escape for themselves and several civilians after they become trapped inside a deadly tunnel collapse; Eddie the dog sniffs out a bomb that has been planted in McGarrett's home.

programme.title: Midsomer Murders
programme.desc: When Midsomer Morchard's very own boxer, John Kinsella, wins a world title in New York, the success seems to be a joyous time for all, until murder rears its ugly head. When a local solicitor is found dead by his assistant and Kinsella's manager, Barnaby attempts to determine what is going on, and soon discover issues with inheritance, affairs, anger, and gambling to make matters difficult. Meanwhile Kinsella's trainer Teddy Molloy (Phil Daniels) has his own hidden agenda. When a re-enactment of a Victorian boxing match gets heated, and Kinsella's manager is found dead in his home's gym, the pair attempt to determine who is responsible, although Barnaby's judgement seems to be clouded on this one.

programme.title: Midsomer Murders
programme.desc: A planning dispute turns to murder, after a leading light in the Midsomer Conservation Society suspects her neighbours are involved in a money-making development scam. Political wrangling, burglaries and sexual liaisons abound in picturesque Great Pelfe - but when a member of the possible scam is themselves murdered, Barnaby wonders what is truly going on behind the scenes of an important by-election.

programme.title: Midsomer Murders
programme.desc: Barnaby reluctantly accompanies Joyce on a spa weekend to Swavely Manor. But as he attempts to de-stress, a woman is found dead in the flotation chamber. He abandons his treatment to investigate, but his personal worries are never far away as he contemplates his future, while trying to determine if an argument between the spa's owners and their neighbours is the motive, or something else.

programme.title: Midsomer Murders
programme.desc: Causton is buzzing at the opening of a new brewery on the site of a famously cursed Abbey. But excitement turns to fear when a man is found boiled to death in one of the vats. DCI Barnaby and DS Winter are puzzled; could this really be about beer?

programme.title: Midsomer Murders
programme.desc: When Mahesh Sidana - butterfly collector and founding member of an elite IQ society - is found murdered, pinned to a wall in a manner akin to his treasured butterfly specimens, DCI Barnaby and DS Winter are thrust into a crime that impacts not only on their community, but internationally. With the help of an old friend, can they catch the culprit before another victim is found...?

programme.title: Midsomer Murders
programme.desc: Carver Valley’s comic festival is in full swing when the village is shocked by the murder of a former supermodel. With a scathing comic shaming several villagers as the only lead, Barnaby and Winter are left trying to separate fact from fiction.

programme.title: Midsomer Murders
programme.desc: Barnaby gets to relive his former days of sporting glory when a death at the local Rugby Club sends Barnaby and Winter into a muddle of rucks, old grudges, new romances… and artisanal chocolates?

programme.title: Midsomer Murders
programme.desc: Barnaby is less than impressed when Sarah drags him to a family friend’s wedding. But things soon go from bad to worse when tragedy strikes and Barnaby is called into action to catch a murderer with an apparent penchant for local brides.

programme.title: Midsomer Murders
programme.desc: Things take a gruesome turn when Ferrabees Circus comes to town, bringing with it a chain of sinister clown sightings, threatening notes and deathly dangerous circus acts. Barnaby will have to face up to his fears in order to solve the case

programme.title: Midsomer Murders
programme.desc: After a local photographer wins an urban myth competition with his creation of The Wolf Hunter, it unexpectedly gains a cult following. However, when a man is killed, Barnaby and Winter must investigate if this myth has become murderous reality.

programme.title: Midsomer Murders
programme.desc: A local outcast, who was controversially acquitted of murder years earlier, is the latest inductee into a post-operative heart rehab club. Following his arrival, members' dreams of a second chance at life begin to be cut short.

programme.title: Midsomer Murders
programme.desc: As the owners of Karras Games gather for a murder mystery weekend, the immersive experience takes a puzzling twist when a killer strikes for real. The police's detective skills are put to the test as they are forced to solve this case on their own.

programme.title: Midsomer Murders
programme.desc: The annual Midsomer Scarecrow Festival takes a grisly turn as bodies begin appearing on poles displayed alongside their straw creations; the investigation reveals rivalries that run deep and shows people will do just about anything to win.

programme.title: Midsomer Murders
programme.desc: The Midsomer Mummers, an amateur operatic society, rehearses for its charity concert when the body of an unknown man is found in the theatre; the investigation quickly becomes a race to discover who is desperate to take centre stage.

programme.title: Midsomer Murders
programme.desc: Each year, the village of Angel's Rise hosts the Psychic Fayre. Founded by the Saint-Stephens family in memory of their late daughter, the event attracts mediums, psychics and followers of the occult. When a body is found surrounded by ritual symbols on the eve of the festival, Barnaby must step into the spiritual world to find the killer.

programme.title: Super Sleuths - Midsomer Murders
programme.desc: The Midsomer Murders team opens up about their experience of working on the popular crime drama and provides insight into the overall process of bringing it to the small screen.

programme.title: Midsomer Murders
programme.desc: After debating on who their next guest speaker should be, the Midsomer Worthy Writers' Circle decide to invite famous writer, Max Jennings, to their next meeting, despite opposition to the choice by Gerald Hadleigh, the group's chairman. When Hadleigh is found dead the day after Jennings visit, brutally bludgeoned and stripped naked, Barnaby and Troy discover that the victim had many mysteries to him, prompting them to delve into his private life and his past. Matters soon become complicated when Jennings disappears and is later found dead, and a witness recalls seeing a mysterious woman in Hadleigh's house the night before his murder.

programme.title: Midsomer Murders
programme.desc: Whilst investigating the murder of Agnes Gray, a quiet animal-loving woman who was bludgeoned to death and found floating in a river near to the village of Ferne Basset, Barnaby gets more than he bargained for when he attends his wife's performance in the Causton Amateur Dramatics' production of Amadeus. When Agnes's cousin, Esslyn Carmichael, inadvertently cuts his own throat during the final act, it's quickly discovered that the tape on the prop blade he had used was removed without anyone knowing. The detective is left wondering who had wanted to turn Esslyn's final act into a true coup de theatre, as he and Troy try to determine what the motive was behind the two murders.

programme.title: Midsomer Murders
programme.desc: Local villagers in Morton Fendle are up in arms, demanding answers from Alan Hollingsworth, the owner of a local craft centre they had invested in, after news comes out that it has recently fallen into financial turmoil. As tensions begin rising in the village, Barnaby soon suspects that something has happened to Alan's wife, Simone, when his behaviour suddenly changes. His suspicions are soon confirmed when it transpires that Simone was kidnapped, after one of Alan's neighbours is murdered, shortly after witnessing something they shouldn't have.

programme.title: Midsomer Murders
programme.desc: Bill Carter, one of the founders of a local New Age commune called the Lodge of the Golden Windhorse, dies suddenly after falling down some stairs and breaking his neck. Although there was uncertainty as to whether it was the result of an accident or murder, Barnaby and Troy find themselves having to determine which it was, when Ian Craigie, the commune's leader, is stabbed to death with a carving knife a few days later, while attending a spiritual seance with the rest of the commune and the parents of one of its members. It's not long before they discover hidden truths about the commune's founding and some of its members.

programme.title: Midsomer Murders
programme.desc: When DCI Barnaby and DS Troy arrive in the sleepy village of Badger's Drift to investigate the sudden death of elderly Miss Emily Simpson, her next door neighbour insists that she had been murdered, after she had seen her return from a walk in the woods, unnerved and shocked by something she had witnessed. When the post mortem confirms her death was no accident, the pair discover that nothing is what it seems to be within the little village as they try to find out what exactly she saw. Their investigation introduces Barnaby and Troy to many eccentric and quirky residents and soon turns up a web of sex, blackmail and lies, and the possibility that the murder could be connected to a shooting accident two years ago, which claimed another woman's life.

programme.title: Midsomer Murders
programme.desc: The ghost village of Little Auburn has been abandoned since the war. When a young man is found murdered during its grand reopening, DCI Barnaby and DS Winter must unravel a sinister web of lies from both past and present in order to catch the killer.

programme.title: Midsomer Murders
programme.desc: The Bleakridge Watch patrols the streets of their remote village, exposing anyone who steps outside the law. When one of their members dies, DCI Barnaby and DS Winter uncover just how far some people will go for power...

programme.title: Midsomer Murders
programme.desc: Tensions run high in Lower Pampling as a new type of cricket threatens a century of tradition. When a star cricketer dies during a tournament, DCI Barnaby and DS Winter's investigation draws them into a dangerous game with a surprise visitor from Barnaby's past...

programme.title: Midsomer Murders
programme.desc: When DCI Barnaby and DS Winter discover a dead body covered in live rabbits it reveals a sinister side to the local pet show. Is this a rivalry taken too far or is the killer driven by something darker?

programme.title: Midsomer Murders
programme.desc: When a young girl slips away from a Jane Austen weekend dressed in period attire, and is found stabbed in the woods, DCI Barnaby and DS Winter need to look back in time to find the killer.

programme.title: Counting Cars
programme.desc: It's all hands on deck when a simple paint job on a 1964 Corvette turns into a full on restoration.

programme.title: Counting Cars
programme.desc: Rock legend Alice Cooper drops by the shop to hang with fellow Detroit rocker Danny, and he leaves his prized '63 Studebaker Avanti behind to get the Count's special treatment.

programme.title: Counting Cars
programme.desc: When Danny challenges the guys to come up with innovative money-making ideas for the shop, Shannon proposes building a bike.

programme.title: Counting Cars
programme.desc: Danny has big plans for a big client. But will his evil twist on a classic Caddy impress the high rolling buyer, or leave him all out of gas?

programme.title: Counting Cars
programme.desc: Ryan, Mike and Shannon convince Danny to sponsor them in a 24-hour endurance race called The LeMons.

programme.title: Counting Cars
programme.desc: Danny continues his El Caminos love affair with a 1975 beauty.

programme.title: Counting Cars
programme.desc: Danny gets sidetracked by a curious lady in a hot pink Beetle while trying to score a classic Ford Galaxie.

programme.title: Counting Cars
programme.desc: When a client rolls into Count's Kustoms with a beautiful 1955 Chevy Nomad, Danny can't help but want the car for his collection.

programme.desc: A Casino VIP visits Count's Kustoms to commission a hi-end chopper build for a huge blackjack bonus prize.

programme.title: Counting Cars
programme.desc: Danny lets painter Ryan take the lead on a 1959 Chevy Panel Truck project he hopes to flip, and later motivates his crew to clean up the shop.

programme.desc: Danny impulsively buys a '69 Caddy and falls madly in love with her. Will he sell it for a big profit, or add her to his collection?

programme.desc: Last year, Count's Kustoms helped Shane surprise his fianc Tanya with a customized classic pick-up truck.

programme.title: Counting Cars
programme.desc: Danny charges Ryan with customizing a brand new Chevy Silverado for their most difficult customer--himself!

programme.title: Counting Cars
programme.desc: A motorcycle-loving couple wants to hit the road like they used to, this time on a Count's Kustoms chopper.

programme.title: Counting Cars
programme.desc: This two-part episode starts with a client asking Danny to find and build a 1979 Camaro Z28, to commemorate the first car he ever owned.

programme.title: Counting Cars
programme.desc: Danny gets a call from Kevin's brother who wants to sell Danny a 1969 Cadillac, but they can't let Kevin know or else he'll never trust his brother or Danny again.

programme.title: Counting Cars
programme.desc: Danny tries to get the derailed '62 Caddy project back on track, while Ryan tries to make amends for a mishap by finding a flip or two for the shop.

programme.title: Counting Cars
programme.desc: Danny has found and bought a replacement for his beloved Dune Buggy "Sparkles." As the guys are turning it into the ultimate 70s beach fantasy.

programme.title: Counting Cars
programme.desc: Danny looks at some of the most famous clients to walk through the doors at Count's Kustoms; Elvira, who needs a facelift for her infamous Macabre Mobile; Chumlee and the Lincoln Continental he wants to flip in true "Pawn Stars" fashion.

programme.title: Counting Cars

programme.title: Counting Cars
programme.desc: Danny's battle with nightmare Z28 continues as he puts it though endless fabrication to bring it back to life. While it's being revived, Danny takes a break.

programme.desc: The shop agrees to build a brave father a hot rod wheelchair, and Danny gets stuck in a bind when a pink car project doesn't go as planned.

programme.desc: A chainsaw accident leaves the crew short-handed; Jason flips a loaded trailer; Shelby finds out if he filled his board foot order.

programme.desc: In Alaska, the Papac team struggles to find someone to fill the shoes of injured Coatsy; Gabe Rygaard and his crew scramble to make up for their slow start; In Wyoming, David Zitterkopf and Sons keep their chainsaws humming.

programme.desc: In Alaska, Papac initiates an extremely dangerous process called Shotgun Logging; in Wyoming, the Zitterkopf men take the Bear Ranch site by storm; at Rygaard, the team doubles the yarders to increase production.

programme.desc: The Rygaards go old school to keep the team on track; Shelby and Bob find a valuable sinker cypress; the Zitterkopf crew tries to take on a dangerous tangle of logs known as "the teepee of death."

programme.desc: Shelby Stanga attempts to upgrade his logging empire, so he tries out some new equipment; DJ Jeremiah just may provide the spark the Rygaard has been missing; Triack's production is slowing down because of steep terrain and narrow logging roads.

programme.title: Pawn Stars
programme.desc: A seller walks into the shop hoping to score with his Magic Johnson 50th birthday invitation; Chum takes a look at some joker playing cards used as props in "The Dark Knight"; Corey heads to the range to test out a Civil War-era derringer.

programme.desc: Rick tackles a football helmet signed by 28 Heisman Trophy winners; Corey gears up to buy a devastatingly cool "Transformers" toy for the shop; Rick tries not to go psycho over an Alfred Hitchcock poster that makes a cameo in the shop.

programme.title: Duck Dynasty
programme.desc: Willie receives a special gift from a Japanese business associate - a "priceless" samurai sword, which Willie keeps out of the hands of Jase and the guys.

programme.title: Duck Dynasty
programme.desc: Willie pushes his work force too far after implementing new "motivational work tactics," and the guys rise up against him and go on strike.

programme.title: Duck Dynasty
programme.desc: When NASCAR sensation Clint Bowyer pays a visit to the Duck Commander warehouse, Willie and the guys are fired up to spend the day hanging out with the professional racecar driver. But too much enthusiasm about the celebrity's mode of transportation turns into a drag race showdown between Willie and Clint. Phil and Si have their hands full fixing Ms. Kay's barbecue when a trip to the outdoor grill store turns disastrous.

programme.title: Duck Dynasty
programme.desc: It's Willie's turn to play Santa Claus at the local church this year but Uncle Si crashes the party and the event goes south in a hurry. Meanwhile, the family gathers at Phil and Miss Kay's house to celebrate the holidays in true redneck fashion.

programme.title: Duck Dynasty
programme.desc: Tomorrow is the opening day of Duck Season and the men are carrying on their tradition of camping on the Robertson Land the night before... including Willie.

programme.title: Duck Dynasty
programme.desc: Gearing up for his high school reunion, Willie realizes that he could stand to lose a few pounds. Jase and Korie set out to help him drop some weight and the strenuous battle of man-versus-waistline begins.

programme.title: Duck Dynasty
programme.desc: The guys learn from Willie that John Luke is going through his first break up. In order to make him feel better the men decide to take John Luke hunting for nutria, and impart their relationship wisdom.

programme.title: Duck Dynasty
programme.desc: When the warehouse guys new office pet (a lizard) escapes, they try all they can in order to catch the wily reptile. Proving impossible, the guys finally decide to bring in the big guns to help trap it--Mr. Phil Robertson.

programme.title: Duck Dynasty
programme.desc: With Willie out-of-town, the guys decide to flake off work and leave to brush up the duck blinds on the Robertson land. While out, Si believes he spots what he thinks is the infamous "Black Panther,"

programme.title: Duck Dynasty
programme.desc: Willie and Jase invite Korie and Missy along on a deer hunt because they believe their wives have become too "city."

programme.title: Duck Dynasty
programme.desc: During Duck Commander's "Casino Night" party for the sale of their 5 millionth duck call, Si Robertson wins the grand prize of $2000 and decides to buy a massage chair for the duck call room.

programme.title: Duck Dynasty
programme.desc: A compilation of the best scenes from all 11 seasons of A&E's hit series Duck Dynasty.

programme.title: Duck Dynasty
programme.desc: Sadie, has a homecoming dance coming up, but Willie doesn't approve of her dress selection. Willie decides to take Sadie out to find her a new "appropriate" dress.

programme.title: Duck Dynasty
programme.desc: Though Jase lost his wedding ring long ago, Missy decides it's time for Jase to replace it with a new one. When Jase is duck hunting, once again, he loses the ring and is forced to come up with a game plan of how to approach and appease Missy.

programme.title: Duck Dynasty
programme.desc: The Duck Commander team is invited to unveil a wing of the local Bass Pro shop that will feature their products.

programme.title: Duck Dynasty
programme.desc: Willie calls the team into work on a Saturday afternoon for an HR training session, but the seminar quickly dissolves from unproductive to complete disaster.

programme.title: Duck Dynasty
programme.desc: Willie's suspicious behavior from dying his beard to buying a new motorcycle, makes Jase come to the conclusion that Willie is having a mid-life crisis. Jase's help turns into a competition amongst the Robertson brothers to see who is most fit.

programme.title: Duck Dynasty
programme.desc: After all their hard work, Willie decides to take the entire Robertson clan on a family vacation to Hawaii.

programme.title: Duck Dynasty
programme.desc: Everyone comes together to plan a surprise wedding for Phil and Kay, setting up a special ceremony on their land, which the whole family attends. Si distracts Phil and Kay by taking them on a "trip down memory lane" to different places.

programme.title: Duck Dynasty

programme.title: Bitchin' Rides
programme.desc: Dave and Kevin, who have been an absolute treat for automotive enthusiasts for years, come back to the SEMA show with something special on their minds.

programme.title: Bitchin' Rides
programme.desc: A Beatles fanatic challenges Dave to paint a modern Rolls-Royce to match the car John Lennon commissioned in the late 1960s.

programme.title: Bitchin' Rides
programme.desc: Dave and Kev take the show as far east as they have ever gone and head to Lake George, New York, for the Adirondack Nationals; the town shuts down for the car show, attracting some of the best on the east coast.

programme.title: Bitchin' Rides
programme.desc: A 1970s Pantera is an iconic sportscar, but once Dave gets his hands on it, the style will never be the same; the client has given Dave free rein to change the car as he sees fit, but has one request: he is 6'4" and can't comfortably get in it.

programme.title: Bitchin' Rides
programme.desc: With the whole team in agreement over the body mods, the crew must make the designs into reality; their list of tasks include bulging out the fenders, creating a spider-shaped exhaust, executing the stretch and getting the car to body.

programme.title: Bitchin' Rides
programme.desc: The Pantera is almost done, but nothing is simple with this car; Dave and Kev get a chance to upgrade their semi rig.

programme.title: Bitchin' Rides
programme.desc: A 1971 Chevy Nova with tremendous pedigree arrives at the shop to get classic Kindig-It styling cues; Dave wants to make this car into a hardtop; tucked-in bumpers, front valance and a new engine provide a good test for the crew.

programme.title: Bitchin' Rides
programme.desc: Will makes miracles happen, and Dave decides to make a wholesale change to the car's color; challenges mount at each stage of the build, and the upholstery shop changes up their routine as the client arrives for a reveal years in the making.

programme.title: Bitchin' Rides
programme.desc: While the shop perfects its process in building the CF1s, word about the car spreads and potential buyers line up; the latest client has a big problem when he can't choose the perfect color combination.

programme.title: Bitchin' Rides
programme.desc: Dave and Kev take the show to the Midwest, as more than 2,500 cars descend on the Summit Motorsports drag strip for a weekend of fun; Kev gets a ride in a lean, mean drag racing machine; Dave steps up his autocross game.

programme.title: Bitchin' Rides
programme.desc: A client enlists Dave on a mission from God to make his dreams of a father/son road trip along Route 66 come true; getting the client's mechanically unsound reproduction of the Bluesmobile ready for the road will test the crew's mettle.

programme.title: Bitchin' Rides
programme.desc: Kevin Schiele breathes new life into a semi-hauler by giving it a visual and functional upgrade that impeccably reflects his expertise in trucks.

programme.title: Bitchin' Rides
programme.desc: Dave finally realizes one of his dreams by opening the Kindig Academy.

programme.title: Bitchin' Rides
programme.desc: Dave and the team determine that a '69 Camaro requires a full rebuild.

programme.title: Bitchin' Rides
programme.desc: The Camaro build hits a snag as the crew tries to get the engine dialed in.

programme.title: Bitchin' Rides
programme.desc: A simple repair turns into a full rebuild for a show-ready '35 Roadster.

programme.title: Bitchin' Rides
programme.desc: The shop hits the road with their freshest builds for a show in Colorado.

programme.title: Bitchin' Rides
programme.desc: The owner of an iconic '55 Nomad wants to boost the power with a blower.

programme.title: Bitchin' Rides
programme.desc: Rick Mezich from "Deadliest Catch" tests Dave's design prowess on his CF1.

programme.title: Bitchin' Rides
programme.desc: A Hummer comes in for a 4WD conversion, engine swap, interior and paint.

programme.title: Bitchin' Rides
programme.desc: The shop has a busy week prepping for the 2022 SEMA show in Las Vegas.

programme.title: Bitchin' Rides
programme.desc: Dave makes modifications to the latest CF1 and announces a pinewood derby.

programme.title: Bitchin' Rides
programme.desc: The crew gears up for the last car show of the year in Scottsdale, Arizona.

programme.title: Bitchin' Rides
programme.desc: A beat-up truck arrives, but underneath all the rust lies a hidden gem.

programme.title: Bitchin' Rides
programme.desc: The body work on the C10 is where the art of the build truly comes out.

programme.title: Bitchin' Rides
programme.desc: Challenges still lie ahead as the C10 moves into final assembly.

programme.title: Iron Resurrection
programme.desc: The team tears into a '62 Chevy truck, and Joe wants to create a lowrider.

programme.title: Iron Resurrection
programme.desc: Joe runs into issues while transforming a '64 Lincoln Continental.

programme.title: Iron Resurrection
programme.desc: The team resurrects a Ford Ranch wagon and turns it into a beach cruiser.

programme.title: Iron Resurrection
programme.desc: A Firebird's build comes to a screeching halt by a water-logged engine.

programme.title: Iron Resurrection
programme.desc: Joe goes back to his roots when the team tackles a custom Softail.

programme.title: Iron Resurrection
programme.desc: Joe's plans for a 1964 Coupe DeVille could be derailed by hidden rust.

programme.title: Iron Resurrection
programme.desc: Shag and Amanda seek a sturdy cab to transform a 1970 Chevy C10 truck.

programme.title: Iron Resurrection
programme.desc: The shop must work all of its magic to resurrect a 1935 Chevy Master.

programme.title: Iron Resurrection
programme.desc: A 1959 Metro rolls into the shop for a makeover from the inside out.

programme.title: Iron Resurrection
programme.desc: The crew works to restore a 1962 Chevy Corvette to factory condition.

programme.title: Iron Resurrection
programme.desc: Joe's mechanical genius is put to the test by a client's 1950 Chevy build.

programme.title: Iron Resurrection
programme.desc: Joe gives a '69 GTO his signature twist with rad body mods and more.

programme.title: Iron Resurrection
programme.desc: Joe and the crew devise big plans for Amanda's find: A 1971 Karmann Ghia.

programme.title: Iron Resurrection
programme.desc: Joe tackles a '62 Impala and money troubles threaten to leave it in limbo.

programme.title: Iron Resurrection
programme.desc: Joe and the crew tackle a '67 Chevy Nova.

programme.title: Iron Resurrection
programme.desc: Joe comes up with a plan for a '59 Impala that looks like a parts donor.

programme.title: Iron Resurrection
programme.desc: A 1970 C10 looks more like a truckload of spare parts than a truck.

programme.title: Iron Resurrection
programme.desc: Joe runs into trouble trying to rebuild a friend's '55 Chevy Bel Air.

programme.title: Iron Resurrection
programme.desc: Joe Martin is excited to see a straight '63 Impala with a four speed and legendary 409 engine under the hood; the owner wants to keep it original with the main mods under the body, new frame, suspension and big wheels.

programme.title: Iron Resurrection
programme.desc: A new customer, comes into the shop with an exceptional 1963 Cadillac; this car screams luxury but needs an upgrade; with Shane giving the MBC team creative freedom on the build, Joe gets to work on a plan; new engine, new wheels and a new interior.

programme.title: Iron Resurrection
programme.desc: Return customer Lee Farris comes to Martin Bros with a 1956 Chevy Bel Air, his first car that he wants to bring back to life; the first thing Joe notices is the outdated flame paint job.

programme.title: Iron Resurrection
programme.desc: Joe makes a high-risk move and chops the top off of a 1950 Mercury coupe.

programme.title: Iron Resurrection
programme.desc: With the 1950 Mercury successfully chopped, the rest of the work can begin; the MBC team now has to marry the old roof with the new geometry of the newly chopped body; there are angles everywhere and they are all out of whack.

programme.title: Iron Resurrection
programme.desc: Joe Martin gets some unusual cars coming through the door of his work shop, but when a customer from California arrives with a '63 Rambler wagon and tells Joe he can do what he wants with it, he decides to go to town with a radical custom job.

programme.title: Iron Resurrection
programme.desc: Joe Martin loves Novas and his eyes light up when a new customer, Eric, wants him to customize a 1972 as a tribute to his brother, if they can find one; Shag and Amanda hunt down a '71, in what appears to be mint condition.

programme.title: Iron Resurrection
programme.desc: Joe Martin and his crew are always under the gun, but their latest build, a '71 Nova, is well behind schedule and they have a ton of work to do; Joe is really going to town on the metal work on this car, inside and out.

programme.title: Iron Resurrection
programme.desc: The Martins face the challenge of trying to fit a 6'5" former football player into the cab of a 1967 Chevy C10, requiring customization of the firewall, motor, frame and interior.

programme.title: Iron Resurrection
programme.desc: Facing deadline, the shop struggles to fit a gigantic ex-NFL player into a tiny 1967 Chevy C10 that includes a customized leather interior and automated bed cover.

programme.title: Iron Resurrection
programme.desc: Joe is pushing his engineering chops to the limit by building a monster trike that would look right at home on the set of a "Mad Max" movie.

programme.title: Bitchin' Rides
programme.desc: Dave and Kevin, who have been an absolute treat for automotive enthusiasts for years, come back to the SEMA show with something special on their minds.

programme.title: Bitchin' Rides
programme.desc: A Beatles fanatic challenges Dave to paint a modern Rolls-Royce to match the car John Lennon commissioned in the late 1960s.

programme.title: Bitchin' Rides
programme.desc: Dave and Kev take the show as far east as they have ever gone and head to Lake George, New York, for the Adirondack Nationals; the town shuts down for the car show, attracting some of the best on the east coast.

programme.title: Bitchin' Rides
programme.desc: A 1970s Pantera is an iconic sportscar, but once Dave gets his hands on it, the style will never be the same; the client has given Dave free rein to change the car as he sees fit, but has one request: he is 6'4" and can't comfortably get in it.

programme.title: Bitchin' Rides
programme.desc: With the whole team in agreement over the body mods, the crew must make the designs into reality; their list of tasks include bulging out the fenders, creating a spider-shaped exhaust, executing the stretch and getting the car to body.

programme.title: Bitchin' Rides
programme.desc: The Pantera is almost done, but nothing is simple with this car; Dave and Kev get a chance to upgrade their semi rig.

programme.title: Bitchin' Rides
programme.desc: A 1971 Chevy Nova with tremendous pedigree arrives at the shop to get classic Kindig-It styling cues; Dave wants to make this car into a hardtop; tucked-in bumpers, front valance and a new engine provide a good test for the crew.

programme.title: Bitchin' Rides
programme.desc: Will makes miracles happen, and Dave decides to make a wholesale change to the car's color; challenges mount at each stage of the build, and the upholstery shop changes up their routine as the client arrives for a reveal years in the making.

programme.title: Bitchin' Rides
programme.desc: While the shop perfects its process in building the CF1s, word about the car spreads and potential buyers line up; the latest client has a big problem when he can't choose the perfect color combination.

programme.title: Bitchin' Rides
programme.desc: Dave and Kev take the show to the Midwest, as more than 2,500 cars descend on the Summit Motorsports drag strip for a weekend of fun; Kev gets a ride in a lean, mean drag racing machine; Dave steps up his autocross game.

programme.title: Bitchin' Rides
programme.desc: A client enlists Dave on a mission from God to make his dreams of a father/son road trip along Route 66 come true; getting the client's mechanically unsound reproduction of the Bluesmobile ready for the road will test the crew's mettle.

programme.title: Bitchin' Rides
programme.desc: Kevin Schiele breathes new life into a semi-hauler by giving it a visual and functional upgrade that impeccably reflects his expertise in trucks.

programme.title: Bitchin' Rides
programme.desc: Dave finally realizes one of his dreams by opening the Kindig Academy.

programme.title: Bitchin' Rides
programme.desc: Dave and the team determine that a '69 Camaro requires a full rebuild.

programme.title: Bitchin' Rides
programme.desc: The Camaro build hits a snag as the crew tries to get the engine dialed in.

programme.title: Bitchin' Rides
programme.desc: A simple repair turns into a full rebuild for a show-ready '35 Roadster.

programme.title: Bitchin' Rides
programme.desc: The shop hits the road with their freshest builds for a show in Colorado.

programme.title: Bitchin' Rides
programme.desc: The owner of an iconic '55 Nomad wants to boost the power with a blower.

programme.title: Bitchin' Rides
programme.desc: Rick Mezich from "Deadliest Catch" tests Dave's design prowess on his CF1.

programme.title: Bitchin' Rides
programme.desc: A Hummer comes in for a 4WD conversion, engine swap, interior and paint.

programme.title: Bitchin' Rides
programme.desc: The shop has a busy week prepping for the 2022 SEMA show in Las Vegas.

programme.title: Bitchin' Rides
programme.desc: Dave makes modifications to the latest CF1 and announces a pinewood derby.

programme.title: Bitchin' Rides
programme.desc: The crew gears up for the last car show of the year in Scottsdale, Arizona.

programme.title: Bitchin' Rides
programme.desc: A beat-up truck arrives, but underneath all the rust lies a hidden gem.

programme.title: Bitchin' Rides
programme.desc: The body work on the C10 is where the art of the build truly comes out.

programme.title: Bitchin' Rides
programme.desc: Challenges still lie ahead as the C10 moves into final assembly.

programme.title: Iron Resurrection
programme.desc: The team tears into a '62 Chevy truck, and Joe wants to create a lowrider.

programme.title: Iron Resurrection
programme.desc: Joe runs into issues while transforming a '64 Lincoln Continental.

programme.title: Iron Resurrection
programme.desc: The team resurrects a Ford Ranch wagon and turns it into a beach cruiser.

programme.title: Iron Resurrection
programme.desc: A Firebird's build comes to a screeching halt by a water-logged engine.

programme.title: Iron Resurrection
programme.desc: Joe goes back to his roots when the team tackles a custom Softail.

programme.title: Iron Resurrection
programme.desc: Joe's plans for a 1964 Coupe DeVille could be derailed by hidden rust.

programme.title: Iron Resurrection
programme.desc: Shag and Amanda seek a sturdy cab to transform a 1970 Chevy C10 truck.

programme.title: Iron Resurrection
programme.desc: The shop must work all of its magic to resurrect a 1935 Chevy Master.

programme.title: Iron Resurrection
programme.desc: A 1959 Metro rolls into the shop for a makeover from the inside out.

programme.title: Iron Resurrection
programme.desc: The crew works to restore a 1962 Chevy Corvette to factory condition.

programme.title: Iron Resurrection
programme.desc: Joe's mechanical genius is put to the test by a client's 1950 Chevy build.

programme.title: Iron Resurrection
programme.desc: Joe gives a '69 GTO his signature twist with rad body mods and more.

programme.title: Iron Resurrection
programme.desc: Joe and the crew devise big plans for Amanda's find: A 1971 Karmann Ghia.

programme.title: Iron Resurrection
programme.desc: Joe tackles a '62 Impala and money troubles threaten to leave it in limbo.

programme.title: Iron Resurrection
programme.desc: Joe and the crew tackle a '67 Chevy Nova.

programme.title: Iron Resurrection
programme.desc: Joe comes up with a plan for a '59 Impala that looks like a parts donor.

programme.title: Iron Resurrection
programme.desc: A 1970 C10 looks more like a truckload of spare parts than a truck.

programme.title: Iron Resurrection
programme.desc: Joe runs into trouble trying to rebuild a friend's '55 Chevy Bel Air.

programme.title: Iron Resurrection
programme.desc: Joe Martin is excited to see a straight '63 Impala with a four speed and legendary 409 engine under the hood; the owner wants to keep it original with the main mods under the body, new frame, suspension and big wheels.

programme.title: Iron Resurrection
programme.desc: A new customer, comes into the shop with an exceptional 1963 Cadillac; this car screams luxury but needs an upgrade; with Shane giving the MBC team creative freedom on the build, Joe gets to work on a plan; new engine, new wheels and a new interior.

programme.title: Iron Resurrection
programme.desc: Return customer Lee Farris comes to Martin Bros with a 1956 Chevy Bel Air, his first car that he wants to bring back to life; the first thing Joe notices is the outdated flame paint job.

programme.title: Iron Resurrection
programme.desc: Joe makes a high-risk move and chops the top off of a 1950 Mercury coupe.

programme.title: Iron Resurrection
programme.desc: With the 1950 Mercury successfully chopped, the rest of the work can begin; the MBC team now has to marry the old roof with the new geometry of the newly chopped body; there are angles everywhere and they are all out of whack.

programme.title: Iron Resurrection
programme.desc: Joe Martin gets some unusual cars coming through the door of his work shop, but when a customer from California arrives with a '63 Rambler wagon and tells Joe he can do what he wants with it, he decides to go to town with a radical custom job.

programme.title: Iron Resurrection
programme.desc: Joe Martin loves Novas and his eyes light up when a new customer, Eric, wants him to customize a 1972 as a tribute to his brother, if they can find one; Shag and Amanda hunt down a '71, in what appears to be mint condition.

programme.title: Iron Resurrection
programme.desc: Joe Martin and his crew are always under the gun, but their latest build, a '71 Nova, is well behind schedule and they have a ton of work to do; Joe is really going to town on the metal work on this car, inside and out.

programme.title: Iron Resurrection
programme.desc: The Martins face the challenge of trying to fit a 6'5" former football player into the cab of a 1967 Chevy C10, requiring customization of the firewall, motor, frame and interior.

programme.title: Dog the Bounty Hunter
programme.desc: Dog and the team go after Kandice, AKA Candy, AKA Suga, a stripper who didn't make her court appearance. They convince one of her friends to lure her to a supermarket parking lot, where Dog has an easy time fetching the fetching young thing.

programme.title: Dog the Bounty Hunter
programme.desc: Dog, taking the day off to try his hand at coaching, assigns Tim and Leland to track down Emmanuel, a fugitive with terminal cancer who's got nothing to lose by running. Can the boys prove to Dog and Beth that they can handle a difficult job on their own?

programme.title: Dog the Bounty Hunter
programme.desc: Dog visits his mother's grave for inspiration before heading out to find Frankie, a violent fugitive hiding in the jungle.

programme.title: Dog the Bounty Hunter
programme.desc: Dog lectures high school students about the dangers of drugs before going after Joseph, a dangerous fugitive who won't be easy to capture. Dog gets special help from a UPS driver,

programme.title: Dog the Bounty Hunter
programme.desc: Dog's latest fugitive, doesn't think small when it comes to illegal drugs: he was carrying almost a pound of methamphetamine when he was arrested. Now he's on the run with his pregnant girlfriend on the high plains of Colorado.

programme.title: Dog the Bounty Hunter
programme.desc: Dog is back in Hawaii and tracking a dangerous fugitive through the jungles of the Big Island. Their prey is being protected by a ring of family and friends that Dog must forcefully confront to bring in his man.

programme.title: Dog the Bounty Hunter
programme.desc: Today's case involves a Samoan so Dog knows that the runner's close-knit kinfolk hold the keys to bringing him in.

programme.title: Dog the Bounty Hunter
programme.desc: Dog and company head to the Big Island in pursuit of two courthouse no-shows only to find that one of them appears to be posting status updates from Southern California.

programme.title: Dog the Bounty Hunter
programme.desc: Dog likes to say, "The apple doesn't fall far from the tree," and this is a hunt where that is true. So will Dog be able to use one family member's troubled ways to catch another one in trouble with the law?

programme.title: Dog the Bounty Hunter
programme.desc: Dog has a big problem. Patty Estabilio has jumped a $15,000 bail bond and disappeared into Hawaii's underworld. Kissing the kids good night, Dog and Beth, with Tim and Leland at their side, plunge into a drug-infused netherworld.

programme.title: Dog the Bounty Hunter
programme.desc: Dog is hunting a man known as "The Godfather of Waikiki". The bond is small, Dog and Beth bailed him out as a courtesy, but now he is refusing to go to court. If Dog doesn't bring him in, it could cost him more than money.

programme.title: Dog the Bounty Hunter
programme.desc: In Hawaii, Dog sets off from Honolulu to Kona to help his son Leland with some of his fugitives. First, a stop at Leland's boxing gym to warm up for their day of hunting with a quick sparring session and some father-and-son time together.

programme.title: Dog the Bounty Hunter
programme.desc: Dog goes after Virginia, a hard-to-find lawbreaker. He gets a tip that a pickup truck will be going to Virginia's house. In true private-eye fashion.

programme.title: Dog the Bounty Hunter
programme.desc: Dog and his team chase down a bail jumper and he tries to help the criminal turn his life around with words of wisdom.

programme.title: Dog the Bounty Hunter
programme.desc: Justin is the low man on the totem pole in the Chapman clan, and this means that the rest of the team is always teasing him.

programme.title: Dog the Bounty Hunter
programme.desc: Dog goes after a fugitive named Tracy who lives in a homeless shelter, but the shelter's staff is uncooperative, and the two sides get into an angry confrontation that forces Dog to temporarily back off.

programme.title: Dog the Bounty Hunter
programme.desc: Dog and Beth take on the heartbreaking case of Rachel. Rachel's mom bailed her out of jail on condition that she go to AA meetings and stick to a curfew.

programme.title: Dog the Bounty Hunter
programme.desc: Dog and the team search for Jonah, a violent and desperate criminal facing 20 years in jail. The trail goes stale when Dog runs into evasive family members and an angry girlfriend.

programme.title: Dog the Bounty Hunter
programme.desc: Baby Lyssa, who's just turned 18 and is studying to become a bondsman, gets to do some on-the-job training when she helps Dog hunt for Wayne, who's run out on a bond for second-degree assault.

programme.title: Dog the Bounty Hunter
programme.desc: Beth designs a luxurious new office for the team and shows it off to Dog, but the bounty hunter is more interested in starting his hunt for Federico, who's been revoked for missing court dates and generally running amuck.

programme.title: Dog the Bounty Hunter
programme.desc: Both brother Tim and fellow Honolulu bondsman James need Dog's help to track down their hard to find fugitives. The two cases on the docket today are challenging, especially the hunt for Gregory, a felon with a lengthy rap sheet.

programme.title: Dog the Bounty Hunter
programme.desc: Today Dog and the family are back in Colorado and are about to make one of their most exciting captures ever. On his search he'll encounter a felon with history of violence and an alleged affection for sawed-off shotguns.

programme.desc: Today Dog and the family are back in Colorado and are about to make one of their most exciting captures ever. On his search he'll encounter a felon with history of violence and an alleged affection for sawed-off shotguns.

programme.title: Dog the Bounty Hunter
programme.desc: Dog has a big problem. Patty Estabilio has jumped a $15,000 bail bond and disappeared into Hawaii's underworld. Kissing the kids good night, Dog and Beth, with Tim and Leland at their side, plunge into a drug-infused netherworld.

programme.title: Dog the Bounty Hunter
programme.desc: Dog is hunting a man known as "The Godfather of Waikiki". The bond is small, Dog and Beth bailed him out as a courtesy, but now he is refusing to go to court. If Dog doesn't bring him in, it could cost him more than money.

programme.title: Dog the Bounty Hunter
programme.desc: In Hawaii, Dog sets off from Honolulu to Kona to help his son Leland with some of his fugitives. First, a stop at Leland's boxing gym to warm up for their day of hunting with a quick sparring session and some father-and-son time together.

programme.title: Dog the Bounty Hunter
programme.desc: Dog goes after Virginia, a hard-to-find lawbreaker. He gets a tip that a pickup truck will be going to Virginia's house. In true private-eye fashion.

programme.title: Dog the Bounty Hunter
programme.desc: Dog and his team chase down a bail jumper and he tries to help the criminal turn his life around with words of wisdom.

programme.title: Dog the Bounty Hunter
programme.desc: Justin is the low man on the totem pole in the Chapman clan, and this means that the rest of the team is always teasing him.

programme.title: Dog the Bounty Hunter

programme.title: Dog the Bounty Hunter
programme.desc: Dog and Beth take on the heartbreaking case of Rachel. Rachel's mom bailed her out of jail on condition that she go to AA meetings and stick to a curfew.

programme.title: Dog the Bounty Hunter
programme.desc: Dog and the team search for Jonah, a violent and desperate criminal facing 20 years in jail. The trail goes stale when Dog runs into evasive family members and an angry girlfriend.

programme.title: Dog the Bounty Hunter

programme.title: Dog the Bounty Hunter
programme.desc: Beth designs a luxurious new office for the team and shows it off to Dog, but the bounty hunter is more interested in starting his hunt for Federico, who's been revoked for missing court dates and generally running amuck.

programme.desc: Dog knows very little about Peter, but what he does know, he doesn't like! Not only is he currently facing two counts of second degree sexual assault, he's racked up numerous restraining orders over the years.

programme.desc: A pregnant wife is killed execution style; an EMT is intent on taking a life.

programme.title: The FBI Files
programme.desc: A Washington DC professor is shot and killed as she tries to get into her car. The killer leaves the body in the parking lot and drives away in her vehicle. A week later, a man robs a bank, and security cameras capture the same vehicle as the getaway car. The FBI believes they are dealing with the same man. Days later, the same vehicle is involved in a shootout with police, but eventually would elude them. Eventually, the vehicle is found, the interior covered with red dye from the stolen bank packs.

programme.title: The FBI Files
programme.desc: Claude Dallas lived the life of a cowboy. A loner and distrustful of authority, he lived off the land, poaching wildlife and selling the hides. But when two game wardens confronted Dallas about his deeds, they were shot and killed. After a massive manhunt, Dallas was captured and convicted, only to escape months later. Making the FBI's Ten Most Wanted list, Dallas eluded the law for almost a year until the FBI tracked him down in a small town in California.

programme.title: The FBI Files
programme.desc: He was a recluse who spread terror through the mail for 18 years. Two men died and more than a dozen were injured, but Ted Kaczynski wasn't known as the Unabomber until his brother tipped off the FBI. Kaczynski's “Unabomber Manifesto,” published in major newspapers, set off a flurry of activity for the FBI: writing analysis and comparisons, DNA gleaned from a single postage stamp and finally, Kaczynski's arrest at his tiny cabin.

programme.title: The FBI Files
programme.desc: In Puerto Rico, the death of a government witness, and the suspicious circumstances surrounding it, lead the FBI and local authorities to suspect corruption in the highest levels of the police force. With the help of a cooperating witness, investigators find the scope of the corruption is far greater that they first thought. Authorities struggle to capture the rouge officers, men who once swore to uphold the law, but now use their power to commit heinous crimes.

programme.title: The FBI Files
programme.desc: In 1988, new light was shed on the mysterious death of a South Carolina farmer when a criminal confessed that two prominent community members hired him to commit murder. Local police and FBI agents arrested a wealthy businessman and later learned that, even behind bars, he commanded the power to corrupt and kill. Using prison informants, agents had to prevent him from murdering again.

programme.title: The FBI Files
programme.desc: On August 20, 1980, an unseen sniper murdered two young black men as they jogged with two white women in Salt Lake City, Utah. Police threw all their resources into finding a killer who left almost no clues behind. They met with FBI agents and detectives from around the country who had similar racially motivated sniper slayings. A month later, working off little more than a possible license plate number, police in Kentucky arrested Joseph Paul Franklin but the man escaped from custody.

programme.title: The FBI Files
programme.desc: In the 1970's, Otpor, a violent arm of the Croatian National Resistance commits terroristic acts against non-supportive Croatians living in the U.S. With the help of an informant, the FBI is able to apprehend, arrest and convict members of the group for crimes ranging from conspiracy and extortion to murder.

programme.title: The FBI Files
programme.desc: In the early 1990's drug gangs terrorized Harlem, New York neighborhoods. When a 10-year-old boy fell victim in the crossfire, NYPD detectives and FBI agents clamped down on the problem. They formed a task force called C-11, designed to dismantle the gangs. In an environment of violence and fear it would be difficult to identify, arrest and convict those involved in the secretive and deadly world of big money drugs.

programme.title: The FBI Files
programme.desc: The rapes and murders of ten women near Tampa, Florida in 1984 had the authorities puzzled and the community scared. Since the beginning, the FBI had been analyzing the crime scene evidence and had found a common link: red trilobal carpet fibers. But there was no suspect, until one of the killer's potential victims survived. Through her interviews and the cooperation of local authorities and the FBI, 31-year-old Bobby Joe Long emerged as the prime suspect.

programme.title: The FBI Files
programme.desc: After a series of brutal bank robberies and murders in south Miami during the mid-1980's, the FBI embarked on an exhaustive eight-month investigation. With little evidence and no suspects, agents were willing to try anything to find the violent perpetrators. On April 11, 1986, agents conducting routine surveillance spotted the vehicle used in the bank robberies. They attempted to arrest the two suspects in the car. What followed was the bloodiest firefight in FBI history.

programme.title: The FBI Files
programme.desc: In 1984, south Miami became the home for a sadistic serial killer. Posing as a fashion photographer, Christopher Wilder lured young women from shopping malls with promises of fame and fortune. Most ended up dead. As the FBI closed in around him, Wilder took off on a cross-country murderous rampage. The FBI added Wilder to their Most Wanted Fugitives program. The chase was on, and Wilder ultimately lost.

programme.title: The FBI Files
programme.desc: In Philadelphia, a ruthless grab for power leads to a full-scale mob war. The local Mafia crime family splits in two as the young and the old fight to the death. The FBI is caught in the middle as they infiltrate the syndicate through informants and high-tech surveillance. Agents must find a way to bring down the organization before their civil war leads to innocent causalities.

programme.title: The FBI Files
programme.desc: When a young boy and his mother were kidnapped and murdered by a vicious drug cartel, FBI agents in the field worked tirelessly to pierce the secretive drug underworld and unearth those involved. Their surveillance and investigative work uncovered a violent trail of murder and greed. FBI agents and forensic examiners pieced together the evidence needed to draw out and then crush the cartel.

programme.title: The FBI Files
programme.desc: In Anchorage, Alaska, a young mother and her two daughters were sexually assaulted and brutally murdered. There was only one piece of forensic evidence: a washrag carrying pubic lice that the killer used to clean himself after the crime. Employing an unusual and original method, an FBI expert combed through all the hairs and fibers in the apartment. He was not only able to determine how long each hair had been there, but which hairs came from the killer and how the crime proceeded.

programme.title: Ancient Aliens
programme.desc: Many brilliant minds believed they did not possess genius, but rather genius possessed them, like a spirit.

programme.title: Ancient Aliens
programme.desc: Cultures all over the world have practiced complex techniques to preserve the human body after death; ancient Egyptians believed mummification ensured entrance into the next life; Buddhist monks practiced self-mummification.

programme.title: Ancient Aliens
programme.desc: Taking a look at incredible stories of the dead rising from their graves; mummies traveling into the afterlife; people on the brink of death mixing with deceased relatives in a celestial netherworld.

programme.title: Ancient Aliens
programme.desc: Messages embedded in sacred religious texts, as well as in the design and location of ancient monuments that may reveal the purpose behind human existence.

programme.title: Ancient Aliens
programme.desc: New evidence suggests that many aspects in the mythical stories of a deluge sent by the gods to engulf the world may actually be true.

programme.desc: An examination of possible encounters humans could have once colonies are established beyond Earth.
